shortcv.p: Mr. ATHANASIOS NIKAS was born in 1976 in Greece. He holds a bachelor’s degree from the Department of Financial and Banking Management at the University of Piraeus (2000) in Greece and a Master’s degree in the Analysis, Design and Management of Information Systems obtained at the London School of Economics and Political Science (2001). Since 2002, he is a candidate Ph.D. researcher in the Department of Management Science and Technology at the Athens University of Economics and Business. His research interest is focusing on studying the social and organisational dynamics which underlie recent technological and work developments in networked organisations. Currently, he works as a research officer in the Electronic Trading Research Unit (ELTRUN). He has a broad research and project management experience stemming from his full involvement in the EU project DOMINO IST-2000-29545 (Dynamic Organisational Management for Inter-firm Network Orchestrations (www.ist-domino.net) while also in 2003 he accumulated a consulting experience by working as an organizer and rapporteur in the Working Group Ε3 of the Greek eBusiness Forum (www.ebusinessfotum.gr) initiative organized by the Hellenic Republic Ministry of Development. Finally, it is worth mentioning that his PhD research is funded from the Hellenic Republic Ministry of Education under the HRAKLEITOS scholarships programme.
